title: Challenge International du Nord
text:
The Challenge international du Nord (Northern International Challenge) was an annual <a href="Association%20football">football</a> tournament featuring clubs from Northern France and <a href="Belgium">Belgium</a> as they could not play in the <a href="Union%20des%20Soci%C3%A9t%C3%A9s%20Fran%C3%A7aises%20de%20Sports%20Athl%C3%A9tiques">French Championship</a>. Later teams from <a href="Switzerland">Switzerland</a>, <a href="Netherlands">Netherlands</a> and England were invited to play. It was hosted in the <a href="Lille">Lille</a> area (<a href="Roubaix">Roubaix</a>, <a href="Tourcoing">Tourcoing</a> and <a href="Lille">Lille</a>) between 1898 and 1914 in different formats.
The Tournament.
The tournament format changed over the years, originally being played between a French group of teams and a Belgium group, with the semi-finals being played between a French and a Belgian team.
From 1905, the tournament was opened to clubs from the <a href="Netherlands">Netherlands</a>, Prinses Wilhelmina en 1905 and GVC Wageningen. Also from <a href="Switzerland">Switzerland</a>, <a href="BSC%20Old%20Boys">BSC Old Boys</a> and <a href="Grasshopper%20Club%20Z%C3%BCrich">Grasshoppers</a>.
Between 1909 and 1914, the tournament was exclusively played between French clubs and amateur clubs from England .
Awards.
With the exception of <a href="Le%20Havre%20AC">Le Havre AC</a> in 1900, the clubs from Belgium won trophies between 1898 and 1908 . <a href="Royale%20Union%20Saint-Gilloise">Royale Union Saint-Gilloise</a> being the most successful reaching four finals in five years and winning three of them (1904, 1905, 1907).
